newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil rail auction may see only one bidder - report.
newsitem.headline: Brazil rail auction may see only one bidder - report.

text.p: The choicest part of Brazil's Federal Railway Network will be privatized Friday but only one group of investors has assured it will take part in the bidding, a local newspaper said.

O Globo said only MRS Logistica, a consortia comprised of steel firms CSN, Usiminas, Cosipa, MBR and Ferteco mining firms and transport group Interferrea, plans to bid on the concession to run the Southeast Line.
A second group, led by Libra shipping firm, also may be interested in taking part in the selloff but it is still being formed, the paper said.

The 1,040-mile rail line, to be sold off on the Rio de Janeiro Stock Exchange, has a base price of 888.9 million reais, 30 percent of which is due at purchase, and a total of 1.1 billion reais in invesment over 30 years, it added.
